Text: The Intel 8088 (""eighty-eighty-eight"", also called iAPX 88) microprocessor is a variant of the Intel 8086.

Text: Intel 8088:  The 16-bit registers and the one megabyte address range were unchanged, however.

Text: Intel 8088:  In fact, according to the Intel documentation, the 8086 and 8088 have the same execution unit (EU)—only the bus interface unit (BIU) is different.

<Text: Intel 8088: The original IBM PC was based on the 8088.>
